column4: I just accidently added a master boot record to a hard drive that only had files on it, it was for storage, now when I do sudo fdisk -l, it doesn't show up, did I destroy it or something?
the ubuntu install asked me to add to the hard drive and it ended up adding the master boot record to my hard drive that had only files on it
I knew I should've unpligged it :(
it's not showing up in testdisk
you can fix mbr with testdisk
but if the drive isn't showing up in testdisk
thats odd indeed, is it ntfs?
yes it is
you installed ntfs-3g?
that might just do it :P
it says ntfs-3g is the newest
try ntfs from software centre
so fdisk wouldn't recognize it if I don't have this installed? let me try it
I'm on kde, there's nothing called ntfs in muon
enable auto boot for ntfs and try a reboot
pastebin your etc/fstab in channel mate, so we can take a look
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1169982/
it's a drive with just files on it
nope, the other two partitions are my windows partition for windows install
haven't even heard of it
would you happen to know whether I need to do anything now to remove the mbr on the drive with the files or anything I need to do?
